page.title: 04RUNNING A TEA-SHOP
page.content:
There are many tea-shops in Burnham-on-Sea because it is a seaside town. On the sea front there is the Old Customs House which used to be used by the customs officer in the days when Burnham was a thriving port. Nowadays it is open to the public for refreshments during the season.
On fine days it is open from early morning until 10.30 pm for anything from a cup of tea to a three course meal, and on less fine days they stay open until it is obvious there will be no more customers.
It is a very busy life running a tea-shop, especially as the customer is always right, but they all enjoy the work, and most of their customers are pleasant and friendly.
